subsection.name: 1.1. Running CayenneModeler
subsection.p: CayenneModeler is a regular Java application and can be run on a JSDK1.4 compatible JVM. Main class is org.objectstyle.cayenne.modeler.Main. For convenience Cayenne distribution provides run scripts to start modeler on Windows and UNIX platforms. To take advantage of these scripts, user must set CAYENNE_HOME (optional) and JAVA_HOME environment variables as described in the installation section.

subsection.name: 1.1.1 Windows Platform
subsection.p: To run CayenneModeler, doubleclick %CAYENNE_HOME%\bin\modeler.bat file in Windows explorer. Alternatively it can be run from command line:

subsection.name: 1.1.3 Mac OS X
subsection.p: Mac OS X users should either follow UNIX command line advise, or simply doubleclick cayenne-modeler.jar from the Finder.app. cayenne-modeler.jar is located under ${CAYENNE_HOME}/lib/modeler/.

subsection.panel: CayenneModeler startup scripts no longer append system CLASSPATH variable to the Modeler startup CLASSPATH as this can cause a number conflicts (e.g. if a user machine has different versions of libraries used by CayenneModeler). If you need to make Modeler aware of your external JAR files (such as JDBC drivers), there is a better way - go to "Tools > Preferences" and configure them under "ClassPath".
